name.japanese: オーロ・ジャクソン号

description: The legendary pirate ship where young Buggy and Shanks served as apprentices. Seen in flashback during Episode 8, showing the two arguing about which pole is colder while Rayleigh observes.

keyEvents.title: Buggy and Shanks' Past on the Oro Jackson
keyEvents.description: Flashback reveals young Buggy and Shanks serving as apprentices on this legendary ship, establishing their long-standing relationship.
keyEvents.significance: First appearance of the ship that will be revealed as belonging to the Pirate King, establishing connection between Buggy, Shanks, and legendary pirates.

keyEvents.title: Rayleigh's First Appearance
keyEvents.description: Silvers Rayleigh appears aboard the Oro Jackson observing the young pirates.
keyEvents.significance: First appearance of a legendary figure who will become crucial to Luffy's development.

keyEvents.title: Buggy's Devil Fruit Incident
keyEvents.description: The location where Buggy accidentally consumed the Bara Bara no Mi after being surprised by Shanks.
keyEvents.significance: The site of a pivotal moment that shapes Buggy's entire life and his grudge against Shanks.

statusHistory.reason: Ship was active during the flashback period

description: A group of islands in the East Blue that includes Syrup Village, where Usopp lives and tells his tales to the village children.

keyEvents.title: Introduction to Gecko Islands
keyEvents.description: The episode briefly shows the Gecko Islands, setting up the crew's next destination.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the setting for the upcoming Syrup Village arc.

keyEvents.title: Usopp's Introduction
keyEvents.description: Usopp is first seen at the Gecko Islands, telling stories to children.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the future Straw Hat sniper is introduced.

statusHistory.reason: Peaceful island group in East Blue

description: A peaceful village in the Gecko Islands where Usopp lives and entertains children with his tall tales. This is where the Straw Hats will have their next adventure.

keyEvents.title: Usopp's First Appearance
keyEvents.description: Usopp is shown in Syrup Village telling stories to local children and proclaiming himself 'Captain Usopp.'
keyEvents.significance: Introduction of Usopp in his home village, setting up the next arc.

keyEvents.title: Poro's First Appearance
keyEvents.description: Poro, one of the village children who listens to Usopp's stories, appears for the first time.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the children who look up to Usopp in the village.

keyEvents.title: Final Battle: Luffy vs Buggy
keyEvents.description: The climactic battle between Luffy and Buggy takes place in Orange Town.
keyEvents.significance: The site of Luffy's first major Devil Fruit vs Devil Fruit battle.

keyEvents.title: Buggy's Defeat
keyEvents.description: Buggy is defeated and sent flying out of Orange Town, ending the arc.
keyEvents.significance: Orange Town is liberated from Buggy's terror.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Donates Treasure
keyEvents.description: Luffy leaves 5,000,000 Belly for the townspeople to rebuild Orange Town.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the positive impact of the Straw Hats and Luffy's values.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Depart Orange Town
keyEvents.description: The crew leaves Orange Town as the citizens wave goodbye and begin rebuilding.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the end of the Orange Town Arc.

statusHistory.reason: Liberated from Buggy, beginning reconstruction with donated funds
